sentence.Network_en: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.--African Proverb

sentence.Network_en: As the proverb goes, time is money.
sentence.Network_cn: 俗语说, 时间就是金钱.

sentence.Network_en: " Practice makes perfect. " is a proverb.
sentence.Network_cn: “ 熟能生巧 ” 是一句谚语.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French proverbe, from Latin proverbium, from pro- ('put) forth' + verbum 'word'

entry.def: A proverb is a short sentence that people often quote, which gives advice or tells you something about life.

example.ex: An old Arab proverb says, 'The enemy of my enemy is my friend'.
example.tran: 一句古老的阿拉伯谚语说，“敌人的敌人是朋友。”

means.word_mean: 1. a condensed but memorable saying embodying some important fact of experience that is taken as true by many people

stems_affixes.word_buile: ad加+verb[n.动词]→加在动词前→副词

verb词语+atim→来自拉丁文:word for word
ad加+verb[n.动词]→加在动词前→副词
pro前面+verb词语→放在前面的词→格言
verbi=verb词语+age状态→词的状态→冗长

Sentence.sentence: For example, Americans today do not pay much attention to the proverb "Haste makes waste", because patience is not important to them.
Benjamin Franklin, a famous American diplomat, writer and scientist, died in 1790, but his proverb "Time is money" is taken more seriously by Americans of today than ever before
Many proverbs remind people of the values that are important in the culture.
